attributes.title: Ammonium Bicarbonate (Food Grade)
attributes.description:
Created on February 20, 2011 by thefoodcloset on Sourcemap.org:

Ammonium bicarbonate (NH4HCO3), also known as hartshown or powdered baking ammonia, is a forerunner of today's baking powder and soda. It is used together with sodium bicarbonate as a leavening agent in the famous Oreo cookie. 

As it will release an unpleasant ammonia smell, it is best to be used in cookies and pastries that are small enough to allow the odour to dissipate while baking. It must also be grounded into powder before using it in food production. 


Although ammonium bicarbonate has many other uses, the food grade ones must not be confused with the household ammonia for cleaning purposes which is poisonous.

Source: 
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ammonium_bicarbonate
http://www.food.com/library/ammonium-bicarbonate-780
